@bolkedebruin The executor branch is ready to begin testing :). The only travis test still breaking is the flake8 tests (part of which because I'm having an issue with one of the migration files) and the only PRs left are for gcp credentials and throttling (both of which are not necessary for at least getting started).

@bolkedebruin  and @Fokko, how would you guys like me to proceed for getting initial users on board? I should be done with the Operator article by next week and will have time to write more documentation then, but I could also host a webinar or just publish a docker container and post a yaml with a basic deployment to the mailing list.
Flake8 nitty stuff

Hi @Fokko 

I've updated my PR to include the test. Regarding Travis tests it seems like the Flake failure is actually referring to the test above me since i don't have `])` included in a multilane statement anywhere in my diff.

Re: py27-backend_mysql failure the only test that fails seems to be: `test_mark_success_no_kill`
and it succeeds for me locally:

```
nosetests tests/jobs.py:LocalTaskJobTest.test_mark_success_no_kill
.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Ran 1 test in 1.182s

OK
[2018-02-08 23:25:25,617] {settings.py:165} DEBUG - Disposing DB connection pool (PID 27049)
```

Please let me know fi you need me to do anything else.
Thanks,
Ian

PS. FWIW it looks like my Travis build at iansuvak/airflow triggered by the same push succeeded:

https://travis-ci.org/iansuvak/airflow/builds/339294531
sure will add tests and update the PR
